noun.description: A marine bivalve mollusk with shells of equal size.

examples: all I got for the job was 50 lousy clams
it was one of the worst times for clamming

verb.description: Abruptly stop talking, either for fear of revealing a secret or from shyness.

origin: Early 16th century: apparently from earlier clam a clamp, from Old English clam, clamm a bond or bondage, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch klemme, German Klemme, also to clamp.
